title: sokani
author: sokani
content: I stumbled on this animated YouTube video that gave a simplified introduction to bitcoin by Cryptomatics and I thought it is worth sharing. For those of us who have kids and would want to educate them at their tender age about bitcoin, I think this video is a great start and a must watch. I would also recommend newbies to check it out as studies has shown that learners respond faster and better to visual contents than textual contents and I believe this would help to fasten their bitcoin learning process.https://youtu.be/pIm2uPXSAWw

comments.author: Nwada001
comments.body: It's an educational animation for an average child to understand; the creator of such an animation must have had pupils for whom he or she prepared this video because the children of this generation are more interested in learning via online and video watching since they are always active using their iPad, and such a video can also be displayed on a projector while explaining things in simple terms for an average man's understanding.The animated video is not just limited to children, though, because it has enough information for everyone who doesn't have an idea of what Bitcoin is and how it works. A lot of information could be gotten from here to make you understand how to use it, and it's different from banking, so you can move ahead with more research if you fall in love with the blockchain.

comments.author: Uruhara
comments.body: Well this is suitable for beginners but Not only for children but seems also suitable for explaining to parents who are interested in bitcoin. With an explanation accompanied by pictures, it can make someone more quickly understand what is conveyed.I also ended up watching it to the end.But of course not for children who don't understand the financial system. but for children who are old enough to understand the basics of the financial system.so I would probably prefer to find this video more suitable for beginners trying to understand the basics of bitcoin. provided that he also has basic insight into the current financial system.

comments.author: Ndabagi01
comments.body: This is an excellent approach to explain and illustrate the use of bitcoin. Recently, I discovered that individuals like to visualize rather than read or go to class to learn new things because it offers them a better comprehension and a full experiential grip in the mind.  This way of learning is simple enough for individuals who only comprehend sign language rather than the language of listening to an explanation. This is a good approach to simplifying the learning process and making bitcoin more understandable to many people including beginners, and not just children.

comments.author: boyptc
comments.body: It was a 4:30 minutes long video. I've firstly noticed about telling that Bitcoin is the first digital currency, I mean that's true in beginners term but straight to the fact, it's not. Much better if it's said that it's the first cryptocurrency in the introduction. However, at the conclusions part, it has mentioned the right thing of what I am saying about being the first crypto.That was a good video but it didn't reiterate about the scams and phishings when it had tackled about safety. It's said that it rarely happens for the theft and only said more about the forgetting of password of the wallet.Well, it's fair enough and this is a good introduction for the newbies and those that haven't heard about Bitcoin. Thanks for sharing op!

comments.author: Dr.Bitcoin_Strange
comments.body: Well, it's good you shared; it might really be helpful for most people. A few days ago, I also came across this thread, in which the video that was shared by the OP is also very educational animated Bitcoin tutorial for kids as well. In the past, I tried to search for some animated videos like that that my nephew would learn from, and although I got some on YouTube too but couldn't make the best choice, these are really good ones that are also coming to the forum. Children mostly learn fast with visual learning, rather than getting them bored with long talks and speeches.

comments.author: Sarah Azhari
comments.body: Quote from: sokani on June 01, 2023, 04:10:48 PMI believe this would help to fasten their bitcoin learning process.Thanks for sharing a video. But sometimes the kids didn't interest to watching educational cartoon videos on youtube because boring and exhausting to hear introductions. I know this from my nephew, his age is 4 years old. He ignores me when I perform videos like this to him. because he is happier when I show him action cartoon videos like Spongebob, Tayo, Dora and etc. This is a big problem for us and the next generation because massive video on youtube has changed the kids' perspectives and don't want to watch and hear about education/introduction that makes them bored. The kids now is more curious when I invite them to a natural thing, my nephew is happy when I take together to a rain shower or draw a picture with a pencil. With this case, I have idea to create flip book cartoon with bitcoin introduction theme, this is more natural thing, where I think make them curious to watch the introduction because something like this is never have been seen before.for example: 1. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3LG4OSk1gE0 2. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=J2xrN5WQuxwI never find yet any flip book about bitcoin, maybe next I have to create itself just for my nephew.

comments.author: mk4
comments.body: Not sure why a lot of people are so obsessed with shoving Bitcoin down their kid's throats. Let them enjoy their childhood for god's sakes. Bitcoin, investing, and finance are good to teach to children but at least wait til they're 16 or so.Still a decent video for kidsnoobs though.

comments.author: Darker45
comments.body: The video is nicely done. Although the animation is like for children, I think it's not really for children. There are certain terms and concepts that are most probably alien to them.  It's basically for beginners. It's a great overview of what Bitcoin is, short yet comprehensive. Anybody could easily digest it, but it would also make them ask questions later. Since the video is generally an overview, it might be interesting to add more to it, ones that are more focused on specific topics. Together, it becomes sort of a Bitcoin course.
